response.answer_text: If you think you might have diabetes, you need to get the lab work done to determine that. It’s a really quick set of tests (urine and blood to test your sugar levels, insulin levels, hormone levels and organ function) and you’ll have results within a week. You could do it at a walk in clinic. Once that’s out of the way, you need to talk to your parents about why they feel they need you to do in person. It could be they don’t feel comfortable leaving you alone at the house for long stretches while they have to work, or they worry you won’t be able to keep up. But get your vitals checked first so everyone’s working off of known quantities.

If you are concerned about being a diabetic, that takes priority over COVID. You ask your parents to get an appointment for testing and discussing your concerns with the doctor. While you are waiting for the results, the doctor will provide the information that you and your parents and school will need to know to adjust your diet, exercise, and studies. As long as you maintain good hygiene and manners, COVID is a manageable concern. If you are concerned about restricting yourself to online studies, ask your doctor to check data for your area and speak with your parents. The only thing you can do is learn the facts, not the rumors, and discuss it to a conclusion.
